You guys realize why the Chinese guy is massively short Nickel right?

The crisis could end without losses for the banks and for Xiang. Tsingshan Holding  asone of the world's largest nickel producers  could benefit from the increase in price if it can get through this patch. Also  if Xiang holds on to his short position and nickel prices decline after the LME reopens  the amount he owes the banks and brokers could fall drastically.
The Chinese guy is hedging his nickel stores against price downside by Shorting futures
This is a normal move for commodity producers
Lots of articles do not mention this and it sounds like he was speculating. This is why the parties are willing to negotiate with him
And why the LME did what it did
Regardless of the demand for Nickel there's no doubt that alot of it is speculation
We don't know whether it is normal hedging or speculating. If over hedging can look like speculating. He can over short what he can supply in the future.

How to Use Commodity Futures to Hedgehttps://www.investopedia.com/articles/active-trading/022415/how-use-commodity-futures-hedge.asp#:~:text=In%20the%20world%20of%20commodities physical%20form%20in%20the%20future.
Maybe but at least he's a producer and one of the largest in the world
Not some financial firm or unrelated industry
If anything he has a reason to be Short more than anyone else
The LME suspension is giving him some time to cough up the margin
He just needs to survive this and his stores of Nickel will pay well if the price inflation remains
My point is that many articles in the news never mentioned he was a Nickel producer and one of the largest in the world. This is why context is so important
